definitions.definition: More than perfect , utterly perfect, ideal .
Pertaining to action completed before another action or event in the past, past perfect .
Relating to a certain type of graph , complying with the theorem ( pluperfect graph theorem ) discovered by D. R. Fulkerson in 1970.
Used as an intensifier in various interjections.
examples: What in the pluperfect hell is going on here?!

main_definition: More than perfect , utterly perfect, ideal .
secondary_definitions: ( grammar ) Pertaining to action completed before another action or event in the past, past perfect .
( mathematics ) Relating to a certain type of graph , complying with the theorem ( pluperfect graph theorem ) discovered by D. R. Fulkerson in 1970.
( informal ) Used as an intensifier in various interjections.
